entry.title: Feedback requested: "reject" p2p message
entry.summary: In an email conversation on October 26, 2013, Jean-Paul Kogelman proposed using fixed length strings or enums. However, it was advised against by another party in the conversation. It was stated that using these options would make it harder to extend without any benefit, as the bandwidth of "reject" messages does not matter and they are rare occurrences that are not relayed.
